Posts.Title: Finally started rads today

Posts.Content: Have you tried the gum or the patch? I know many used those and quit. Have you talked to your doctor? I am sure that between him and you, you will come up with something that might help quitting. I had a girlfriend that kept carrots always on hand, tootsie roll pops, anything that she could eat or just put in her mouth to prolong her lighting a cigarette. And, when she wanted to smoke, she would just put it off for maybe 15 minutes or so longer, and eventually, she was not smoking for hours in between. I know it is difficult to quit, and, I am so proud of you for trying. I am sending you lots and lots of will power! Hugs, Noel

Posts.Title: CALMNESS IN OUR LIVES OVER THE HOLIDAYS

Posts.Content: I am a little red, not bad burnt yet from Radiation treatments. Today will be #20 with 17 more to go, the last being 12 boosters. But now, I have these red itchy bumps that drive me nuts. The radiation oncologist gave me hydrocortisone to use for that, but, it isn't taking away all of the itching. Anyone else have any ideas? I will certainly ask my radiation oncologist before I use anything else, but, I just wanted some options. And, my skin feels so tight, especially at the top of the radiation on my throat. And, this is weird, but, my nose has been congested ever since I started radiation. They say it isn't possible that the radiation is doing it, but, it started with my first treatment, gets better on the weekends when I don't have treatments, and then gets worse when I start again. RaDiAtIoN SuCkS!

Posts.Title: Definitely NOT Dancing With Ned

Posts.Content: I actually went to the thermogaphy site and it states that it is NOT a test that should stand alone in the diagnosis of breast cancer. It says that it SHOULD be used in conjunction with mammography, MRI and biopsy's. They compliment each other it states. No where in any article does it state that it can show up microcalcifications, which is a big part of what alerts tech's to the fact that there is something going on in a breast. A mammogram shows this up. This thermography was very helpful, but, shouldn't be the only test you have for breast cancer, as, it can miss cancer. It also states that over 23% of all breast cancers are found in women under 49. That was kind of shocking. They kind of alude to the fact that it is because of the estrogen. Which, I think, we all know is a huge factor in breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Interesting cancer study... looking for feed back.

Posts.Content: Rae, it is certainly not uncommon to receive that letter. Just relax and breathe a little easier knowing that. Set your appointment and let us know!
Posts.Title: I'm scared

Posts.Content: My MRI took probably an hour. And, they put an iv in me and I was laying face down, very uncomfortable, but doable. My arms were held out in front of me. My chest was elevated so that my boobs kind of hung down in a thing. When they put the stuff in me, thru the iv, it made me feel weird, but, it only lasted a few minutes, maybe seconds. You have to lay perfectly still. The machine is very noisy. Also, the techs keep talking to you thru headphones and you can listen to music if you want. Hope that helps you! I took a nerve pill beforehand to help me to relax. Good luck!

Posts.Content: Hi Angie. The plus sign next to the name means that particular person is not in your friends list. If it has a minus, then they are in your friends list. If you want to add someone as a friend, just click on their name, a screen will come up asking if you want to add them as your friend, and, click on yes or add if you want to add them as a friend. I think that is how it works. You can try it with me if you want. And, I like your funny bear, or, I guess it is a bear. lol ♥ Noel

Posts.Content: Wishing everyone a Great New Year filled with everything good! ♥ Noel
Posts.Title: I Just Want To Wish All Of You A Very Healthy & Happy New Year!

Posts.Content: You just have to give yourself time. It could take months, or, it could take years. I don't think there is a timetable to follow. Just relax and know that it will come. Our bodies and minds have been thru so much and some may never get over it. But, focus on the positive and live your life! That is the best advice I can give you!
Posts.Title: So, if i'm done...

Posts.Content: I used the same cream that Ritzy used. Ask your rads oncologist about it. I am sure he can give you something to help. Good luck!
Posts.Title: What can I do to stop the itch?

Posts.Content: Just glad that your onco is giving you something to help. I hope it does. If it doesn't, please try the cream. Sleep? What's that? lol Get some sleep and stop that itching and always post anything that bothers you. That's why we're here. Good luck, Noel
Posts.Title: What can I do to stop the itch?

Posts.Content: My husband made reservations awhile back for a very nice restaurant that is very hard to get into. So, I am thrilled!!! I bought a really pretty angora red dress, so, I will be dressed for Valentine's Day! He is hinting around that he got me a piece of jewelry, so, we will see. He always buys the greatest gifts for me. I love Valentine's Day!!! Have a Happy Valentine's Day!
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: I love your writing Ritzy! You make me feel like I am there! Your evening sounded perfect and then I read about the hanging hearts and it got beyond perfect! Does your husband have a brother? Kidding! I wouldn't trade my husband for anything. Thanks for sharing this with us. Noel
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: Scared of this too, and, even more so now. Yikes!
